hook.text: Researchers gave half a class coffee mugs and asked them to sell. Sellers wanted twice what buyers offered.

buildup.text: The endowment effect means we overvalue things simply because we own them.

discovery.text: In investing, this makes you hold a mediocre stock because 'it's mine' rather than swap for a better one.

twist.text: Ask yourself: 'If I didn't own this, would I buy it today at this price?' Usually the answer is no.

climax.text: Treating every position as a fresh decisionâ€”own or cashâ€”cuts through the endowment illusion.

punchline.text: Owning something doesn't make it worth more. That's just your brain talking.

quiz.question: What is the endowment effect?
